title: Format: I.Foundations/Financial Engineering/10.OtherTopics.md
description:
**File:** `./I. Foundations/Financial Engineering Course Lecture Notes/Lecture Notes/10. Other Topics in Quantitative Finance.md`

Manual formatting remediation task. HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task with NO scripts or automation.

**Section:** I. Foundations - Financial Engineering
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields: `title` (plain text), `tags` (YAML list), `cssclasses: academia`

### Phase 3: Content Processing (per 200-300 line chunk)

**A. Text & Structure:**
- Join mid-sentence line breaks (line 1 no terminal punct + line 2 starts lowercase)
- STOP if line 2 starts with: | - > $$ ```
- Single H1, use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Bullets: normalize all to `-`

**B. LaTeX/Math:**
- Fix OCR: `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`, `di erent` → `different`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Block math `$$` on own lines with blank before/after
- Inline math no spaces: `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape: `50%` → `50\\%`, `$50` → `\\$50`

**C. Tables:** PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables - DO NOT convert

**D. TOC:** Remove dotted leaders and page numbers

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
- Clear existing tags, generate new ones
- 1-2 (small <200 lines), 3-5 (medium), 8-10 (large >500 lines)
- snake_case, domain-relevant, reusable across vault
- Fair distribution from throughout document

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove practice questions sections (# Practice Questions, # Problems, # Exercises)

## REFERENCE: Review `styleguide/` folder

## UPDATE: Log all corrections in bead issue notes after each chunk
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete
- [ ] Single H1 at top
- [ ] Mid-sentence breaks repaired
- [ ] Bullets normalized to `-`
- [ ] LaTeX properly formatted
- [ ] OCR artifacts fixed
- [ ] Tables preserved
- [ ] Tags generated (appropriate count)
- [ ] All corrections logged
- [ ] No scripts used

**Phase 2:** YAML cleanup - Required: title, tags, cssclasses: academia
**Phase 3:** Per-chunk fixes:
- A: Text - join mid-sentence breaks, normalize bullets to `-`, single H1
- B: LaTeX - fix OCR artifacts, spaced operators, block $$ on own lines
- C: Tables - PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables
- D: TOC - remove dotted leaders/page numbers
**Phase 4:** Tags - clear existing, generate new (1-2 small, 3-5 medium, 8-10 large)
**Phase 5:** Remove practice questions sections

## REFERENCE: styleguide/ folder
## UPDATE: Log corrections in issue notes after each chunk

title: Format: Financial Metrics Formulas.md
description:
**File:** `./Financial Metrics Formulas.md`

Manual formatting remediation task for this Obsidian vault markdown file. This is a HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task requiring iterative chunk-based processing with NO scripts or automation.
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields (add if missing):
- `title`: Plain text, Title Case (NO markdown formatting)
- `tags`: YAML list format (will be replaced with new tags)
- `cssclasses`: Must be `academia`
- Optional: `key_concepts`, `parent_directory`

### Phase 3: Chunk-by-Chunk Content Processing
For each 200-300 line chunk, fix:

**A. Text & Structure Issues:**
- Mid-sentence line breaks: Join lines where line 1 ends without terminal punctuation (. ? ! : ;) AND line 2 starts lowercase
- STOP joining if line 2 starts with: | (table), - (list), > (quote), $$ (math), ``` (code)
- Headings: Ensure single H1 (#), use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Convert Problem/Example: `### Problem 2.1` → `**Problem 2.1**`
- Bullets: Normalize all (*, +, •, ●) to `-`
- Lists: No blank lines between items, one blank before list starts

**B. LaTeX/Math Issues:**
- OCR artifacts: Fix spaced numbers `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`
- Fix spaced commands: `\\ t e x t { yield }` → `\\text{yield}`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Fix split words: `di erent` → `different`, `e ect` → `effect`
- Block math: `$$` must be on own lines with blank line before/after
- Inline math: No spaces inside `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape percentages: `50%` → `50\\%` in both text and math
- Currency: Escape `$50` → `\\$50`, replace `\\mathbb{S}` → `\\$`

**C. Tables & Assets:**
- PRESERVE HTML tables and LaTeX tabular - DO NOT convert
- Fix only clearly broken markdown table pipes
- Standardize images to `![[filename.png]]` or `![alt](path)`

**D. TOC/Outline Cleanup:**
- Remove dotted leaders and page numbers from TOC entries
- Format TOC as clean markdown list or remove if redundant

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
1. Clear existing tags in YAML frontmatter
2. Read ENTIRE document to extract key concepts
3. Generate tags based on document size:
   - Small (< 200 lines): 1-2 tags
   - Medium (200-500 lines): 3-5 tags
   - Large (> 500 lines): 8-10 tags
4. Tag requirements:
   - Use snake_case format
   - Domain-relevant to finance/economics/quantitative methods
   - Reusable across vault (not hyper-specific)
   - Fair distribution from throughout document, not just top
5. Add as YAML list: `tags: [tag_one, tag_two, tag_three]`

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove sections containing practice questions:
- Headers like: `# Practice Questions`, `# Problems`, `# Exercises`, `# Questions and Problems`
- Delete header and all content following to EOF or next major section

## REFERENCE MATERIALS
Review `styleguide/` folder for complete rules:
- `style-guide-v4.md` - Comprehensive formatting rules
- `formatting_prompt.md` - Manual remediation protocol
- `obsidian_formatting_rules.md` - File structure, LaTeX rules

## UPDATE REQUIREMENTS
After processing EACH chunk:
1. Update this bead issue with progress notes
2. Log ALL corrections made in format:
   ```
   Line X: `original text` → `corrected text`
   ```
3. Note any ambiguous cases skipped
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete with all required fields
- [ ] Single H1 heading at document top
- [ ] All mid-sentence line breaks repaired
- [ ] All bullet points normalized to `-`
- [ ] All LaTeX math properly formatted (block on own lines, inline no spaces)
- [ ] All OCR artifacts fixed (spaced text, split words)
- [ ] All tables preserved (HTML/LaTeX not converted)
- [ ] TOC/outline properly formatted
- [ ] Practice questions section removed (if present)
- [ ] Tags generated and added (appropriate count for doc size)
- [ ] Tags distributed fairly from throughout document
- [ ] All corrections logged in bead issue notes
- [ ] No scripts or automation used

description:
**File:** `./I. Foundations/Financial Engineering Course Lecture Notes/Lecture Notes/3. MartingalePricingDiscreteModels.md`

Manual formatting remediation task for this Obsidian vault markdown file. This is a HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task requiring iterative chunk-based processing with NO scripts or automation.

**Section:** I. Foundations - Financial Engineering
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields (add if missing):
- `title`: Plain text, Title Case (NO markdown formatting)
- `tags`: YAML list format (will be replaced with new tags)
- `cssclasses`: Must be `academia`
- Optional: `key_concepts`, `parent_directory`

### Phase 3: Chunk-by-Chunk Content Processing
For each 200-300 line chunk, fix:

**A. Text & Structure Issues:**
- Mid-sentence line breaks: Join lines where line 1 ends without terminal punctuation (. ? ! : ;) AND line 2 starts lowercase
- STOP joining if line 2 starts with: | (table), - (list), > (quote), $$ (math), ``` (code)
- Headings: Ensure single H1 (#), use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Convert Problem/Example: `### Problem 2.1` → `**Problem 2.1**`
- Bullets: Normalize all (*, +, •, ●) to `-`
- Lists: No blank lines between items, one blank before list starts

**B. LaTeX/Math Issues:**
- OCR artifacts: Fix spaced numbers `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`
- Fix spaced commands: `\\ t e x t { yield }` → `\\text{yield}`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Fix split words: `di erent` → `different`, `e ect` → `effect`
- Block math: `$$` must be on own lines with blank line before/after
- Inline math: No spaces inside `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape percentages: `50%` → `50\\%` in both text and math
- Currency: Escape `$50` → `\\$50`, replace `\\mathbb{S}` → `\\$`

**C. Tables & Assets:**
- PRESERVE HTML tables and LaTeX tabular - DO NOT convert
- Fix only clearly broken markdown table pipes
- Standardize images to `![[filename.png]]` or `![alt](path)`

**D. TOC/Outline Cleanup:**
- Remove dotted leaders and page numbers from TOC entries
- Format TOC as clean markdown list or remove if redundant

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
1. Clear existing tags in YAML frontmatter
2. Read ENTIRE document to extract key concepts
3. Generate tags based on document size:
   - Small (< 200 lines): 1-2 tags
   - Medium (200-500 lines): 3-5 tags
   - Large (> 500 lines): 8-10 tags
4. Tag requirements:
   - Use snake_case format
   - Domain-relevant to finance/economics/quantitative methods
   - Reusable across vault (not hyper-specific)
   - Fair distribution from throughout document, not just top
5. Add as YAML list: `tags: [tag_one, tag_two, tag_three]`

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove sections containing practice questions:
- Headers like: `# Practice Questions`, `# Problems`, `# Exercises`, `# Questions and Problems`
- Delete header and all content following to EOF or next major section

## REFERENCE MATERIALS
Review `styleguide/` folder for complete rules:
- `style-guide-v4.md` - Comprehensive formatting rules
- `formatting_prompt.md` - Manual remediation protocol
- `obsidian_formatting_rules.md` - File structure, LaTeX rules

## UPDATE REQUIREMENTS
After processing EACH chunk:
1. Update this bead issue with progress notes
2. Log ALL corrections made in format:
   ```
   Line X: `original text` → `corrected text`
   ```
3. Note any ambiguous cases skipped
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete with all required fields
- [ ] Single H1 heading at document top
- [ ] All mid-sentence line breaks repaired
- [ ] All bullet points normalized to `-`
- [ ] All LaTeX math properly formatted (block on own lines, inline no spaces)
- [ ] All OCR artifacts fixed (spaced text, split words)
- [ ] All tables preserved (HTML/LaTeX not converted)
- [ ] TOC/outline properly formatted
- [ ] Practice questions section removed (if present)
- [ ] Tags generated and added (appropriate count for doc size)
- [ ] Tags distributed fairly from throughout document
- [ ] All corrections logged in bead issue notes
- [ ] No scripts or automation used

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields: `title` (plain text), `tags` (YAML list), `cssclasses: academia`

### Phase 3: Content Processing (per 200-300 line chunk)

**A. Text & Structure:**
- Join mid-sentence line breaks (line 1 no terminal punct + line 2 starts lowercase)
- STOP if line 2 starts with: | - > $$ ```
- Single H1, use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Bullets: normalize all to `-`

**B. LaTeX/Math:**
- Fix OCR: `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`, `di erent` → `different`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Block math `$$` on own lines with blank before/after
- Inline math no spaces: `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape: `50%` → `50\\%`, `$50` → `\\$50`

**C. Tables:** PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables - DO NOT convert

**D. TOC:** Remove dotted leaders and page numbers

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
- Clear existing tags, generate new ones
- 1-2 (small <200 lines), 3-5 (medium), 8-10 (large >500 lines)
- snake_case, domain-relevant, reusable across vault
- Fair distribution from throughout document

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove practice questions sections (# Practice Questions, # Problems, # Exercises)

## TASK: Manual Formatting Remediation
Process this markdown file in 200-300 line chunks using Edit tool only.

## CONSTRAINTS
- NO scripts/automation - manual only
- Use Edit tool for targeted fixes (never rewrite chunks)
- Read every line; ensure old_string has 3-4 lines context

## PROTOCOL
**Phase 1:** Read file, check YAML, note length
**Phase 2:** YAML cleanup - Required: title, tags, cssclasses: academia
**Phase 3:** Per-chunk fixes:
- A: Text - join mid-sentence breaks, normalize bullets to \`-\`, single H1
- B: LaTeX - fix OCR artifacts, spaced operators, block \$\$ on own lines
- C: Tables - PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables
- D: TOC - remove dotted leaders/page numbers
**Phase 4:** Tags - clear existing, generate new (1-2 small, 3-5 medium, 8-10 large)
**Phase 5:** Remove practice questions sections

## REFERENCE: styleguide/ folder

acceptance_criteria:

- [ ] Single H1
- [ ] LaTeX formatted

description:
**File:** `./I. Foundations/Financial Engineering Course Lecture Notes/Lecture Notes/6. IntroStochCalc A Brief Introduction to Stochastic Calculus.md`

Manual formatting remediation task. HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task with NO scripts or automation.

**Section:** I. Foundations - Financial Engineering
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields: `title` (plain text), `tags` (YAML list), `cssclasses: academia`

### Phase 3: Content Processing (per 200-300 line chunk)

**A. Text & Structure:**
- Join mid-sentence line breaks (line 1 no terminal punct + line 2 starts lowercase)
- STOP if line 2 starts with: | - > $$ ```
- Single H1, use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Bullets: normalize all to `-`

**B. LaTeX/Math:**
- Fix OCR: `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`, `di erent` → `different`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Block math `$$` on own lines with blank before/after
- Inline math no spaces: `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape: `50%` → `50\\%`, `$50` → `\\$50`

**C. Tables:** PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables - DO NOT convert

**D. TOC:** Remove dotted leaders and page numbers

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
- Clear existing tags, generate new ones
- 1-2 (small <200 lines), 3-5 (medium), 8-10 (large >500 lines)
- snake_case, domain-relevant, reusable across vault
- Fair distribution from throughout document

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove practice questions sections (# Practice Questions, # Problems, # Exercises)

## REFERENCE: Review `styleguide/` folder

## UPDATE: Log all corrections in bead issue notes after each chunk
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete
- [ ] Single H1 at top
- [ ] Mid-sentence breaks repaired
- [ ] Bullets normalized to `-`
- [ ] LaTeX properly formatted
- [ ] OCR artifacts fixed
- [ ] Tables preserved
- [ ] Tags generated (appropriate count)
- [ ] All corrections logged
- [ ] No scripts used

design:
## TASK: Manual Formatting Remediation
Process this markdown file in 200-300 line chunks using Edit tool only.

## CONSTRAINTS
- NO scripts/automation - manual only
- Use Edit tool for targeted fixes (never rewrite chunks)
- Read every line; ensure old_string has 3-4 lines context

## PROTOCOL
**Phase 1:** Read file, check YAML, note length
**Phase 2:** YAML cleanup - Required: title, tags, cssclasses: academia
**Phase 3:** Per-chunk fixes:
- A: Text - join mid-sentence breaks, normalize bullets to \`-\`, single H1
- B: LaTeX - fix OCR artifacts, spaced operators, block \$\$ on own lines
- C: Tables - PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables
- D: TOC - remove dotted leaders/page numbers
**Phase 4:** Tags - clear existing, generate new (1-2 small, 3-5 medium, 8-10 large)
**Phase 5:** Remove practice questions sections

## REFERENCE: styleguide/ folder
## UPDATE: Log corrections in issue notes after each chunk

- [ ] LaTeX formatted
- [ ] Tags generated

title: Format: I.Foundations/Financial Engineering/2.ForwardsSwapsFutures.md
description:
**File:** `./I. Foundations/Financial Engineering Course Lecture Notes/Lecture Notes/2. Forwards, Swaps, Futures, and Options.md`

Manual formatting remediation task for this Obsidian vault markdown file. This is a HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task requiring iterative chunk-based processing with NO scripts or automation.

**Section:** I. Foundations - Financial Engineering
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields (add if missing):
- `title`: Plain text, Title Case (NO markdown formatting)
- `tags`: YAML list format (will be replaced with new tags)
- `cssclasses`: Must be `academia`
- Optional: `key_concepts`, `parent_directory`

### Phase 3: Chunk-by-Chunk Content Processing
For each 200-300 line chunk, fix:

**A. Text & Structure Issues:**
- Mid-sentence line breaks: Join lines where line 1 ends without terminal punctuation (. ? ! : ;) AND line 2 starts lowercase
- STOP joining if line 2 starts with: | (table), - (list), > (quote), $$ (math), ``` (code)
- Headings: Ensure single H1 (#), use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Convert Problem/Example: `### Problem 2.1` → `**Problem 2.1**`
- Bullets: Normalize all (*, +, •, ●) to `-`
- Lists: No blank lines between items, one blank before list starts

**B. LaTeX/Math Issues:**
- OCR artifacts: Fix spaced numbers `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`
- Fix spaced commands: `\\ t e x t { yield }` → `\\text{yield}`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Fix split words: `di erent` → `different`, `e ect` → `effect`
- Block math: `$$` must be on own lines with blank line before/after
- Inline math: No spaces inside `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape percentages: `50%` → `50\\%` in both text and math
- Currency: Escape `$50` → `\\$50`, replace `\\mathbb{S}` → `\\$`

**C. Tables & Assets:**
- PRESERVE HTML tables and LaTeX tabular - DO NOT convert
- Fix only clearly broken markdown table pipes
- Standardize images to `![[filename.png]]` or `![alt](path)`

**D. TOC/Outline Cleanup:**
- Remove dotted leaders and page numbers from TOC entries
- Format TOC as clean markdown list or remove if redundant

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
1. Clear existing tags in YAML frontmatter
2. Read ENTIRE document to extract key concepts
3. Generate tags based on document size:
   - Small (< 200 lines): 1-2 tags
   - Medium (200-500 lines): 3-5 tags
   - Large (> 500 lines): 8-10 tags
4. Tag requirements:
   - Use snake_case format
   - Domain-relevant to finance/economics/quantitative methods
   - Reusable across vault (not hyper-specific)
   - Fair distribution from throughout document, not just top
5. Add as YAML list: `tags: [tag_one, tag_two, tag_three]`

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove sections containing practice questions:
- Headers like: `# Practice Questions`, `# Problems`, `# Exercises`, `# Questions and Problems`
- Delete header and all content following to EOF or next major section

## REFERENCE MATERIALS
Review `styleguide/` folder for complete rules:
- `style-guide-v4.md` - Comprehensive formatting rules
- `formatting_prompt.md` - Manual remediation protocol
- `obsidian_formatting_rules.md` - File structure, LaTeX rules

## UPDATE REQUIREMENTS
After processing EACH chunk:
1. Update this bead issue with progress notes
2. Log ALL corrections made in format:
   ```
   Line X: `original text` → `corrected text`
   ```
3. Note any ambiguous cases skipped
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete with all required fields
- [ ] Single H1 heading at document top
- [ ] All mid-sentence line breaks repaired
- [ ] All bullet points normalized to `-`
- [ ] All LaTeX math properly formatted (block on own lines, inline no spaces)
- [ ] All OCR artifacts fixed (spaced text, split words)
- [ ] All tables preserved (HTML/LaTeX not converted)
- [ ] TOC/outline properly formatted
- [ ] Practice questions section removed (if present)
- [ ] Tags generated and added (appropriate count for doc size)
- [ ] Tags distributed fairly from throughout document
- [ ] All corrections logged in bead issue notes
- [ ] No scripts or automation used

title: Format: I.Foundations/Financial Engineering/1.DeterministicCashFlows.md
description:
**File:** `./I. Foundations/Financial Engineering Course Lecture Notes/Lecture Notes/1. DeterministicCashFlows.md`

Manual formatting remediation task for this Obsidian vault markdown file. This is a HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task requiring iterative chunk-based processing with NO scripts or automation.

**Section:** I. Foundations - Financial Engineering
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields (add if missing):
- `title`: Plain text, Title Case (NO markdown formatting)
- `tags`: YAML list format (will be replaced with new tags)
- `cssclasses`: Must be `academia`
- Optional: `key_concepts`, `parent_directory`

### Phase 3: Chunk-by-Chunk Content Processing
For each 200-300 line chunk, fix:

**A. Text & Structure Issues:**
- Mid-sentence line breaks: Join lines where line 1 ends without terminal punctuation (. ? ! : ;) AND line 2 starts lowercase
- STOP joining if line 2 starts with: | (table), - (list), > (quote), $$ (math), ``` (code)
- Headings: Ensure single H1 (#), use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Convert Problem/Example: `### Problem 2.1` → `**Problem 2.1**`
- Bullets: Normalize all (*, +, •, ●) to `-`
- Lists: No blank lines between items, one blank before list starts

**B. LaTeX/Math Issues:**
- OCR artifacts: Fix spaced numbers `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`
- Fix spaced commands: `\\ t e x t { yield }` → `\\text{yield}`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Fix split words: `di erent` → `different`, `e ect` → `effect`
- Block math: `$$` must be on own lines with blank line before/after
- Inline math: No spaces inside `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape percentages: `50%` → `50\\%` in both text and math
- Currency: Escape `$50` → `\\$50`, replace `\\mathbb{S}` → `\\$`

**C. Tables & Assets:**
- PRESERVE HTML tables and LaTeX tabular - DO NOT convert
- Fix only clearly broken markdown table pipes
- Standardize images to `![[filename.png]]` or `![alt](path)`

**D. TOC/Outline Cleanup:**
- Remove dotted leaders and page numbers from TOC entries
- Format TOC as clean markdown list or remove if redundant

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
1. Clear existing tags in YAML frontmatter
2. Read ENTIRE document to extract key concepts
3. Generate tags based on document size:
   - Small (< 200 lines): 1-2 tags
   - Medium (200-500 lines): 3-5 tags
   - Large (> 500 lines): 8-10 tags
4. Tag requirements:
   - Use snake_case format
   - Domain-relevant to finance/economics/quantitative methods
   - Reusable across vault (not hyper-specific)
   - Fair distribution from throughout document, not just top
5. Add as YAML list: `tags: [tag_one, tag_two, tag_three]`

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove sections containing practice questions:
- Headers like: `# Practice Questions`, `# Problems`, `# Exercises`, `# Questions and Problems`
- Delete header and all content following to EOF or next major section

## REFERENCE MATERIALS
Review `styleguide/` folder for complete rules:
- `style-guide-v4.md` - Comprehensive formatting rules
- `formatting_prompt.md` - Manual remediation protocol
- `obsidian_formatting_rules.md` - File structure, LaTeX rules

## UPDATE REQUIREMENTS
After processing EACH chunk:
1. Update this bead issue with progress notes
2. Log ALL corrections made in format:
   ```
   Line X: `original text` → `corrected text`
   ```
3. Note any ambiguous cases skipped
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete with all required fields
- [ ] Single H1 heading at document top
- [ ] All mid-sentence line breaks repaired
- [ ] All bullet points normalized to `-`
- [ ] All LaTeX math properly formatted (block on own lines, inline no spaces)
- [ ] All OCR artifacts fixed (spaced text, split words)
- [ ] All tables preserved (HTML/LaTeX not converted)
- [ ] TOC/outline properly formatted
- [ ] Practice questions section removed (if present)
- [ ] Tags generated and added (appropriate count for doc size)
- [ ] Tags distributed fairly from throughout document
- [ ] All corrections logged in bead issue notes
- [ ] No scripts or automation used

design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`, check YAML frontmatter, note file length

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required: `title` (plain text), `tags` (YAML list), `cssclasses: academia`

### Phase 3: Content Processing (per 200-300 line chunk)
**A. Text & Structure:** Join mid-sentence breaks, single H1, normalize bullets to `-`
**B. LaTeX/Math:** Fix OCR artifacts, spaced operators, block math on own lines
**C. Tables:** PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables
**D. TOC:** Remove dotted leaders and page numbers

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
Clear existing, generate new (1-2 small, 3-5 medium, 8-10 large), snake_case, domain-relevant

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove practice questions sections

## REFERENCE: Review `styleguide/` folder
## UPDATE: Log all corrections in bead issue notes after each chunk
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete
- [ ] Single H1 at top
- [ ] LaTeX properly formatted
- [ ] Tags generated (appropriate count)
- [ ] All corrections logged
- [ ] No scripts used

- Use Edit tool for targeted fixes (never rewrite chunks)
- Read every line; ensure old_string has 3-4 lines context

## PROTOCOL
**Phase 1:** Read file, check YAML, note length
**Phase 2:** YAML cleanup - Required: title, tags, cssclasses: academia
**Phase 3:** Per-chunk fixes:
- A: Text - join mid-sentence breaks, normalize bullets to \`-\`, single H1
- B: LaTeX - fix OCR artifacts, spaced operators, block \$\$ on own lines
- C: Tables - PRESERVE HTML/LaTeX tables
- D: TOC - remove dotted leaders/page numbers
**Phase 4:** Tags - clear existing, generate new (1-2 small, 3-5 medium, 8-10 large)
**Phase 5:** Remove practice questions sections

## REFERENCE: styleguide/ folder
## UPDATE: Log corrections in issue notes after each chunk

- [ ] Single H1
- [ ] LaTeX formatted
- [ ] Tags generated

title: Format: Bretton Woods.md
description:
**File:** `./Bretton Woods.md`

Manual formatting remediation task for this Obsidian vault markdown file. This is a HIGH-TOUCH, FULLY MANUAL task requiring iterative chunk-based processing with NO scripts or automation.
design:
## TASK OVERVIEW
Process this markdown file iteratively in chunks (200-300 lines max), manually identifying and fixing all formatting issues using the Edit tool for targeted corrections.

## CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS
1. **NO SCRIPTS OR AUTOMATION** - This is entirely manual work
2. **USE EDIT TOOL ONLY** - Make targeted fixes, never rewrite entire chunks
3. **READ EVERY LINE** - Do not infer content; paginate through entire file
4. **ATOMIC EDITS** - Ensure old_string has enough context (3-4 lines) to be unique

## PROCESSING PROTOCOL

### Phase 1: Initial Assessment
1. Read file with `read_file(path, limit=300)`
2. Check YAML frontmatter exists and starts on line 1
3. Note file length to plan chunk processing

### Phase 2: YAML Frontmatter Cleanup
Required fields (add if missing):
- `title`: Plain text, Title Case (NO markdown formatting)
- `tags`: YAML list format (will be replaced with new tags)
- `cssclasses`: Must be `academia`
- Optional: `key_concepts`, `parent_directory`

### Phase 3: Chunk-by-Chunk Content Processing
For each 200-300 line chunk, fix:

**A. Text & Structure Issues:**
- Mid-sentence line breaks: Join lines where line 1 ends without terminal punctuation (. ? ! : ;) AND line 2 starts lowercase
- STOP joining if line 2 starts with: | (table), - (list), > (quote), $$ (math), ``` (code)
- Headings: Ensure single H1 (#), use ## for sections, ### for subsections
- Convert decimal headings: `3.1.1 Abstract` → `#### 3.1.1 Abstract`
- Convert Problem/Example: `### Problem 2.1` → `**Problem 2.1**`
- Bullets: Normalize all (*, +, •, ●) to `-`
- Lists: No blank lines between items, one blank before list starts

**B. LaTeX/Math Issues:**
- OCR artifacts: Fix spaced numbers `0 . 0 5` → `0.05`
- Fix spaced commands: `\\ t e x t { yield }` → `\\text{yield}`
- Fix spaced operators: `\\operatorname {V a r}` → `\\operatorname{Var}`
- Fix split words: `di erent` → `different`, `e ect` → `effect`
- Block math: `$$` must be on own lines with blank line before/after
- Inline math: No spaces inside `$x=y$` not `$ x = y $`
- Escape percentages: `50%` → `50\\%` in both text and math
- Currency: Escape `$50` → `\\$50`, replace `\\mathbb{S}` → `\\$`

**C. Tables & Assets:**
- PRESERVE HTML tables and LaTeX tabular - DO NOT convert
- Fix only clearly broken markdown table pipes
- Standardize images to `![[filename.png]]` or `![alt](path)`

**D. TOC/Outline Cleanup:**
- Remove dotted leaders and page numbers from TOC entries
- Format TOC as clean markdown list or remove if redundant

### Phase 4: Tag Generation
1. Clear existing tags in YAML frontmatter
2. Read ENTIRE document to extract key concepts
3. Generate tags based on document size:
   - Small (< 200 lines): 1-2 tags
   - Medium (200-500 lines): 3-5 tags
   - Large (> 500 lines): 8-10 tags
4. Tag requirements:
   - Use snake_case format
   - Domain-relevant to finance/economics/quantitative methods
   - Reusable across vault (not hyper-specific)
   - Fair distribution from throughout document, not just top
5. Add as YAML list: `tags: [tag_one, tag_two, tag_three]`

### Phase 5: Content Exclusion
Remove sections containing practice questions:
- Headers like: `# Practice Questions`, `# Problems`, `# Exercises`, `# Questions and Problems`
- Delete header and all content following to EOF or next major section

## REFERENCE MATERIALS
Review `styleguide/` folder for complete rules:
- `style-guide-v4.md` - Comprehensive formatting rules
- `formatting_prompt.md` - Manual remediation protocol
- `obsidian_formatting_rules.md` - File structure, LaTeX rules

## UPDATE REQUIREMENTS
After processing EACH chunk:
1. Update this bead issue with progress notes
2. Log ALL corrections made in format:
   ```
   Line X: `original text` → `corrected text`
   ```
3. Note any ambiguous cases skipped
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] YAML frontmatter complete with all required fields
- [ ] Single H1 heading at document top
- [ ] All mid-sentence line breaks repaired
- [ ] All bullet points normalized to `-`
- [ ] All LaTeX math properly formatted (block on own lines, inline no spaces)
- [ ] All OCR artifacts fixed (spaced text, split words)
- [ ] All tables preserved (HTML/LaTeX not converted)
- [ ] TOC/outline properly formatted
- [ ] Practice questions section removed (if present)
- [ ] Tags generated and added (appropriate count for doc size)
- [ ] Tags distributed fairly from throughout document
- [ ] All corrections logged in bead issue notes
- [ ] No scripts or automation used
